messages.message:
Instructions to do dbupdate on your sandbox. Seek help of PRE if you need assistance.
• cd tools/onprem/dbupdate
• Add `"sandbox-aws": {}` entry to `deployment/env/deployment-config.json` (in `tools/onprem/dbupdate/` )
• make push-sandbox-aws
• make spec-dep-sandbox-aws
• copy the INSTABASE_BACKEND_DB_PARAMS from core-platform-service of your sandbox into the dbupdate.yml
• kubectl apply -f ../../../build/dev/deployments/onprem-dbupdate.yml
-aws likely needs to become -azure for azure sandboxes cc @Xi Cheng
can you actually get the `INSTABASE_BACKEND_DB_PARAMS` used by each of the sandboxes this way? @Shubham Oli
Anil also pointed out one needed step here for updating this on aws sandboxes: add an `"sandbox-aws": {}` entry to `tools/onprem/dbupdate/deployment/env/deployment-config.json`
If someone’s using a local dev database, they also need to update right?
The local dev database is the same as dogfood and UAT
Oh I meant if one has setup a separate local mysql
oh yeah if you have local db’s for local dev then yes you would have to run dbupdate on those too. (or just nuke the DB and start from scratch by initialiting a new one with dbinit)
